definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: But sweet or colour it had stol'n from thee.
sentences.chinese: 有哪種花不偷你的芳香和色澤。

sentences.english: His only recreations are drinking beer or staying in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 僅有的消遣是喝啤酒和在花園裏種花草。

sentences.english: I think it's perfect weather for gardening.
sentences.chinese: 我想今天的天氣非常適合種花。

sentences.english: I indulged my interest in flowers for several years by planting a large flower garden.
sentences.chinese: 我在一個大花園裏種花，熱衷花卉若干年。

sentences.english: The same evening he went to a florist's.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上他去了一個種花人的家裏。

sentences.english: Do Chinese people like to plant flowers?
Planting flowers along the boulevards will help to beautify the town.
sentences.chinese: 沿林陰大道種花將有助於美化城鎮。

sentences.english: We would collect a small sum from each resident to plant flowers and bushes.
sentences.chinese: 我們還將從每家每戶集點兒資種花草和灌木。

sentences.english: Gardening not only beautifies our environment, it also puts our minds at ease.
sentences.chinese: 種花除了可以美化環境，還可以讓自己心靈沈澱許多。

sentences.english: Do you know where the garden tools are? It's...
sentences.chinese: 你知道種花的工具在哪裏嗎？

sentences.english: During your free time you work on your garden, listen to music, read prose, and go shopping.
sentences.chinese: 閒時種花養草，聽音樂，讀散文，逛大街。

sentences.english: E.g. He likes plants very much， so he is familiar with many flowers.
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡植物，所以知道很多種花。

sentences.english: Napoleon passed the time reading, gardening and dictating his memoirs.
sentences.chinese: 拿破崙在那裏靠閱讀，種花和寫回憶錄打發時間。

sentences.english: My grandfather liked planting flowers very much.
His only recreations are drinking beer and working in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 僅有的消遣是喝啤酒和在花園裏種花草。

definition: to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
to play or strum a lute or other stringed instrument
style (of art or literature)/form/one's work style/moral character
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
